text: The Michigan Avenue Bridge (officially DuSable Bridge) is a bascule bridge that carries Michigan Avenue across the main stem of the Chicago River in downtown Chicago, Illinois, United States. Construction of the bridge started in 1918, it opened to traffic in 1920, and decorative work was completed in 1928. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Bridges in Chicago Category:1920 establishments in the United States Category:1920s establishments in Illinois
title: Michigan Avenue Bridge
